comment.text: This translation key is used for the title of a download app button on an Android device, prompting users to access organization documents on Google Play. The key appears in a mobile app and will be displayed on screen as part of a UI element.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation lacks a leading article 'of' before 'Google Play'. It should read 'Google Play-dən...'.

The English phrase 'Get' is translated as 'Laden Sie herunter'. While 'Laden Sie herunter' can mean 'download', 'Get' implies availability and retrieval. A more direct and natural translation would be 'Erhält {{organizationName}} Documents im Google Play Store'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Erhält {{organizationName}} Documents im Google Play Store

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'en el Google Play' is not the most natural way to express 'on Google Play' in Spanish. It's technically correct, but 'en Google Play' is more idiomatic and commonly used.

The English content uses "on Google Play". The Armenian translation also includes "on Google Play-ում". While not strictly incorrect, the inclusion of the suffix '-ում' is redundant and makes the sentence slightly awkward. It's more natural to omit it.
The Japanese translation lacks a space before the 'Documents' word.  It is directly attached to the previous Japanese word.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: GooglePlayで{{organizationName}} Documentsを入手する → GooglePlayで{{organizationName}} Documents を入手する

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Obtenha o {{organizationName}} Documents na Google Play' is not ideal. 'na' should be 'na Google Play' or 'em Google Play'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Obtenha o {{organizationName}} Documents na Google Play Store

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase " ලබා ගන්න" (laban ganne) literally translates to 'obtain' or 'get' but in this context, 'download' would be more appropriate and natural for a mobile app context. 'Get' is acceptable, but 'download' conveys the intended action more clearly.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Google Play හි {{organizationName}} ලේඛන බාගත කරන්න

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian translation uses a genitive case ending ('-у') after 'Google Play'. While grammatically acceptable, it's more common and stylistically better to use the dative case ('Google Play-у') in this context when referring to obtaining something *on* a platform. It's a minor stylistic preference.

The Serbian translation 'Nabavi {{organizationName}} Dokumenta na Google Play-u' doesn't accurately convey the meaning of 'Get {{organizationName}} Documents on Google Play'. 'Nabavi' implies 'to acquire' or 'to procure,' which is a stronger action than 'get'.  'Get' is more common and user-friendly in this context.
The preposition 'na' is used with a locative case, which might be perceived as slightly awkward. While grammatically correct, it's worth considering a more natural phrasing.

The English phrase 'Get' is better translated as '获取' or '获取到' rather than simply '下载' (download). While 'download' isn't wrong, it's a more literal translation and doesn't fully capture the nuance of 'Get'.
